channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Data Meanderer

item.title: About me
item.author: mathesong@gmail.com (Granville Matheson)
item.description: My name is Granville Matheson and I’m a PhD student in neuroscience at the Karolinska Institute in Stockholm, Sweden. My work is currently mostly focused on Pharmacokinetic modelling Statistical analysis Reproducible workflows Measurement error Image analysis The purpose of this blog is to have a place to put fun little data-science side projects, tutorials, or really whatever ends up feeling interesting enough that I want to put it out into the world.

item.title: Papers
item.author: mathesong@gmail.com (Granville Matheson)
item.description: 2018 Matheson, GJ (2018). We need to talk about reliability: Making better use of test retest studies for study design and interpretation. bioRxiv, 274894. Matheson, GJ, Plavén-Sigray, P, Louzolo, Anaïs, Borg, J, Farde, L, Petrovic, P & Cervenka, S (2018). Dopamine D1 receptor availability is not associated with delusional ideation measures of psychosis proneness. bioRxiv, 321646. Plavén-Sigray, P, Matheson, GJ, Gustavsson, Petter, Stenkrona, P, Halldin, C, Farde, L & Cervenka, S (2018).
